question_text: Which scenarios would benefit from using a port replicator? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: A traveling consultant needing extra USB ports
A permanent office setup with dual monitors
A field technician connecting to Ethernet occasionally
A user wanting to upgrade GPU performance
A video editor connecting a RAID array
correct_answer: A traveling consultant needing extra USB ports
A field technician connecting to Ethernet occasionally
explanation: Port replicators are ideal for portable setups where lightweight USB-based expansion is needed. Permanent or performance-heavy setups benefit more from full docking stations.
